text:
Biologist with a Master’s degree in Natural Sciences, with a strong interest in data analysis and the use of digital tools to investigate and understand complex biological systems. My background combines scientific research with data-driven problem solving, enabling me to work confidently with diverse datasets. I apply analytical thinking, data visualisation, and computational approaches to derive meaningful insights across academic, health-related, and applied data contexts.


Scientific Researcher Data Analyst and Scientist

Biologist with a Master’s degree in Natural Sciences, with a strong interest in data analysis and the use of digital tools to investigate and understand complex biological systems. My background combines scientific research with data-driven problem solving, enabling me to work confidently with diverse datasets. I apply analytical thinking, data visualisation, and computational approaches to derive meaningful insights across academic, health-related, and applied data contexts.


Scientific Researcher Data Analyst and Scientist

Formal education

Master of Sciences (MSc) in Natural Sciences
Universidad del Rosario, Bogotá, Colombia
Bachelor of Sciences (BSc) in Biology
Universidad del Rosario, Bogotá, Colombia

Research
PDF Scientific CV

Research Experience
Research Assistant – GIMUR / CIMBIUR
Universidad del Rosario (2021–2024)

Participated in projects on genomic surveillance of emerging pathogens, including SARS-CoV-2 and Monkeypox virus.
Characterized the microbial ecology of various biological systems using next-generation sequencing (NGS).
Conducted molecular and bioinformatic analyses on different microbes using Sanger, Illumina or Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT)



Research Interests

Microbial ecology and evolution
Computational Metagenomics
Epidemiology and zoonotic diseases
Data analytics in life sciences

Here you will find different data analysis projects that show the application of statistical and computational tools to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets. These projects cover various topics, from public health to exploratory business analytics, and demonstrate the use of techniques such as data cleaning, visualisation, and dashboard creation. Each project aims to communicate findings clearly and effectively, using tools like Excel, Python, R, and Power BI.


Geographic and geospatial analyses of COVID-19 in Colombia: Trends in case distribution, recovery, and mortality (2023–2024)
This project consists of an interactive dashboard that allows users to explore the evolution of cases, recoveries and deaths at geographical (departments and municipalities), demographic (age, sex and ethnic group) and clinical (patient status and type of infection) levels.
Objectives of the analysis:

Examine the dynamics of positive COVID-19 cases, recoveries, and deaths at the geographical, demographic, and clinical levels during the years 2023–2024
Calculate KPIs such as percentage of deaths, recoveries, and active cases

Dashboard:

Files:


 Report (.pdf)   Power BI File (.pbix)   Dataset (.xlsx)
